content:
robi99 said
A message that you sent could not be delivered to one or more of its recipients. This is a permanent error. The following address(es) failed: andrew.krischock@outlook.com host outlook-com.olc.protection.outlook.com [52.101.40.5] SMTP error from remote mail server after pipelined sending data block: 550 5.7.1 Unfortunately, messages from [103.150.252.1] weren't sent. Please contact your Internet service provider since part of their network is on our block list (S3150). You can also refer your provider to http://mail.live.com/mail/troubleshooting.asp[truncated]

So what does you mail provider (atmailcloud) have to say about the block listing of the mail you send? The error is pretty clear the issue is with the server and Thunderbird doe not supply a server, your mail provider does.

atmailcloud is the base domain for the IP address mentioned. I have no idea who they are, but it appear they are https://www.atmail.com/ or Atmail Pty Ltd Suite 251, Level 18, 324 Queen Street, Brisbane QLD, 4000 and they appear to be linked in someway to "The Messaging Company" which at least one major Australian ISP passed all of their email services to in the last 12 months. SO perhaps you need to contact them, not your ISP.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Dit kan in uw accountinstellingen. Tik op het menupictogram linksboven > Instellingen (tandwiel) linksonder > account selecteren > Bericht versturen > Standaard samenstelling > Handtekening.

Let wel op, de Android-versie heeft minder mogelijkheden voor hoe de handtekening eruit ziet, maar kan wel meerdere regels omvatten.

creator: @next

content:
Hai già chiesto a Tiscali? Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next

content: You can verify that all is lost by these steps: - at desktop, enter %appdata% in search bar and press enter. That takes you to file explorer and the appdata\roaming folder. If there is a folder named Thunderbird, your email data 'may' have been preserved. Click the folder and see if there is a folder named profiles. If so, check that folder to see if profiles are present. - if no thunderbird folder, then you're starting over. Just reenter the account info to set up the email accounts.
creator: davidsk

content: cortesemente avendo un account di posta con abc@pec.it la cartella che dovrei trovare come si chiama? abc?
creator: dpernesto

content:
Per gli account POP3 si trovano nella cartella mail in una sottocartella che ha il nome del server POP, per esempio pop.example.org Per gli account IMAP nella cartella imapmail in una sottocartella con il nome del server IMAP, ad esempio imap.example.org

Se hai più account che usano lo stesso server, oltre al nome ci sarà un numero.

content: Something is preventing thunderbird from updating settings when closing down. This might be a vpn or antivirus, or even that the prefs.js file in the profile is read-only. I have no idea what is causing that for your computer.
creator: davidsk

content:
re : I have saved as a sig file

Where is that sig file located eg: on computer in 'Documents' in a folder called 'TB Signatures' ? Is the file saved as a html file ?

Check your 'prefs.js' file location. Exit Thunderbird now if it's running.

  • In windows search type : %Appdata%
  • Select : %Appdata% file folder
  • Select : 'Roaming' folder
  • Select : 'Thunderbird' folder
  • Select 'Profiles' folder to see profile name folder
  • Select 'profile name' folder to see contents

In 'View' - Make sure you have selected the option 'File name extensions'. Look for 'prefs.js' Do you also see a load of 'prefs' files but they have a number eg: prefs-1.js ?

Please post an image which shows all the prefs files ?

Check the 'prefs.js' file

  • Right click on 'prefs.js' file and select 'Properties'
  • On 'General' tab
  • At the bottom 'Attributes' - Is the 'Read-only' checkbox selected ?
  • If yes, please uncheck that option and click on 'Apply' then click on 'OK'
creator: Toad-Hall

content: Chiedi al tuo provider email di sbloccarti l'uso tramite la VPN. Thunderbird non può aggirare questo tipo di limitazioni.
